授業目的:
Course title: Labour Mobility and Population Imbalance in the EU
You will learn about the (social, economic, fiscal) benefits and risks of labour mobility in the EU. You will understand the costs of population imbalance and the risks the rapid population decline in rural areas pose.
We will use examples from different EU countries, including Germany, Italy, Bulgaria, Latvia and Rumania to learn why people move to another (EU) country, thereby understanding different societies, their labour markets, and their long-term problems.

This course hopes to provide a deeper understanding of migration and labour mobility in the EU. In order to better understand the development in the EU, we will also look at migration to Japan as well as Japan's shrinking rural population.
到達目標:
You will understand the many (social & economic) benefits and disadvantages migration & labour mobility pose in the EU. You will understand why people move away from rural areas in Japan and EU countries and what problems this pose. You will also learn why smaller towns and villages are gaining in popularity in many European counties.

Through this course, you will acquire different soft skills, such as Academic English, presentation skills, discussion skills, critical & analytical thinking and independent research skills.
